title: Quantum Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of fundamental quantum concepts â€” wavefunctions, superposition, and a healthy dose of chaos. ðŸ’¥

questions.question: What is wave-particle duality?
options: Particles can behave like waves, and waves like particles.
A particle is a wave if you observe it.
Wave-particle duality means particles move in circles.
It means particles are made of water.

questions.question: What does Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle state?
option: You can never know your cat's true intentions.
You can't simultaneously know the exact position and momentum of a particle.
Uncertainty means science is just guessing.
Particles will disappear if you look too closely.

questions.question: What is superposition?
options: A particle can be in multiple states at once until measured.
Superposition is just a fancy word for teleportation.
It means the particle has superpowers.

questions.question: What is a qubit?
options: A classical bit's chaotic cousin that can be 0, 1, or both.
Just a regular bit with a new haircut.

questions.question: What causes wavefunction collapse?
options: A measurement or observation being made.

questions.question: What does Planck's constant represent?
options: The smallest possible quantum of energy.
The rate at which particles spin.
The length of a quantum ruler.

questions.question: What is quantum tunnelling?
options: Particles spontaneously teleport through barriers they shouldn't pass.
When your code gets stuck in a loop.

questions.question: What is entanglement?
options: Two particles sharing a telepathic vibe across the cosmos.

questions.question: Which force is responsible for holding electrons in atoms?
What is a photon?
options: A particle that glows in the dark.

future_features: At the end of the quiz, users will be shown resources for any questions they got wrong.
Users will be able to bookmark tricky topics for revision.
